* Introduction

Configuration for NixOS and user home (dot files). It is provided via Nix flakes and includes the following components:

** Usage

*** With Flake

[[https://nixos.wiki/wiki/Flakes][wiki Flakes]]

- NixOS module

  #+begin_example
    sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake '$@'
    $@ => "flake file directory#hostname"
  #+end_example

- Nix-Darwin module

  1. Install Nix-Darwin and apply the configuration by

     #+begin_example
       nix-shell -p nix --command "nix build --experimental-features 'nix-command flakes' '$@'"
       ./result/sw/bin/darwin-rebuild switch --flake '$@'
       $@ => "flake file directory#darwinConfigurations.hostname.system"
     #+end_example

  2. Since the release 21.05, building a flake-based configuration is as simple as

     #+begin_example
       darwin-rebuild switch --flake '$@'
       $@ => "flake file directory#hostname"
     #+end_example

- Non-Nixos

  1. Install Home Manager and apply the configuration by

     #+begin_example
       nix-shell -p nix --command "nix build --no-link --experimental-features 'nix-command flakes' '$@'"
       ./result/activate
       $@ => "flake file directory#homeConfigurations.username.activationPackage"
     #+end_example

  2. Since the release 21.05, building a flake-based configuration is as simple as

     #+begin_example
       home-manager switch --flake '$@'
       $@ => "flake file directory#username"
     #+end_example

- Nix-on-droid

  #+begin_example
    nix-on-droid switch --flake '$@'
    $@ => "flake file directory#devicename"
  #+end_example
